title: Bot lane it's not the problem. It's a consequence of a even bigger problem.
body:
If supports received super OP defensive items to nullify damage for your whole team through the seasons, was because riot introduced enough damage in the game to easily annihilated a whole team without effort. If support new runes are full of boring, ridiculous, binding and anti-fun free defensive status it's also because runes randomly increased the damage of everyone else by a whole fucking lot for no freaking reason at all. Runes not only have a fucking high base damage but also scale through the game.

Well fuck this hate on supports. 

Ask a  traditional support this season to not build any item that give shields, heals or increase shields and heals and see what happens. Spoiler alert: prepare yourself to hardest stomp of your life. You are doomed to buy that shit. It's not an option. We are hostages of that shit balance where riot increase damage to the sky and then we need to create  new forms every season to nullify damage too.

I want to support through my champion kit. I want my champion kit reworked, buffed, nerfed, whatever to make sure that my core mission is complete without item shenanigans but i can't. I'm hostage of the insane fucking damage everyone have.

Check this small and innocent rune: press the attack. It give a fucking flat bonus damage and increase all damages by 12%.

12 FUCKING %

I used to do 3 millions backflips to get the mastery that used to increase our damage by 3%. Fuck this. 

Damage is so insanely high that riot forced the support role to build all sort of shit to try to even things out.  If building a support item was a question of decision making and interesting gameplay, I would not mind. {{item:2065}} {{item:3174}} {{item:3905}}  are a good example of a support items I enjoy and they are either not too oppressive or are just not a raw stick of necessary power.

Please, rework soraka again and all supports too, and fuck items and fuck the damage and fuck runes.

No OP you totally missed the issue at hand.

Riot made several changes to this game that over time creates this problem. It mostly stemmed from two problems. 
1. Support was not popular role
2. The game length needed to be shortened 


They addressed this in many ways. Some of those changes indirectly or directly affected the bot lane. For example
1. Passive gold, exp in duo lane was increased. Gold for assist kills was increased and decreased for solo kills. Catch up experience was increase and allowed duo lanes to keep up in exp to solo laners
2.  They shortened games by increasing base damages and introducing % to far wider range of champions
3. Increase wave clear for all lanes
4. First turret blood was introduced
5. Cooldown were lowered to increase players fighting more often over objectives
6. Baron was buffed
7. Burst from anti ADC champions were lowered to add more counterplay
8. ADC gold cost of their items during tank rework was lowered. Every item at that time except BOTRK was buffed
9. Supports items got revamped like Ardent. This gave them much better synergy with ADC than with any other role/class
10. Passive gold for lane was increased so that champions can reach late game fasters
11. Wards were changed to be limited and now you don’t even have to buy a sight stone as a support

Now, all of these changes impacted every lane. The problem is, riot succeeded in make game shorter and support more popular. They result is, top laners and Mid lane, who once excelled in early and mid game no longer have that HUGE window. Back in s5 and s6, each lane phase was roughly 15-20 minutes. Mid game was 15-25 minutes. Now, you can lose a tower by 9-10 minutes. Your window of opportunity has been lowered. Supports and especially ADC used to be weak early and mid game. Now, these two classes reach mid-late game spikes so much faster. Once you reach 20-25 minutes, it is effectively late game for many ADC champions. By then, most ADCs have their core items (3-4) items and their supports have the items to cement the power of ADC. 

Now, the bot lane can snow ball even earlier. This was something that top and mid lanes used to depend one.  Supports would be healthier if Riot actually introduced items which benefits other classes more directly. Instead they introduce items like Ardent Censor which works with ADCs 10X than any other role. Noticed how good Nuni became when Riot gave him a buff which was really good on AP champions. That was just one ability and champion. Imagine introducing items that directly affect non ADC.

TLDR: Riot nerfed the length of early and mid game, now bot lane can survive and dictate how the flows much earlier.

You're missing the point. The game has powercrept the supports in response to the increased damage environment, and increased damage to respond to support strength, and so forth. At this point it doesn't matter which is the chicken or the egg, and that is the insidious problem of unchecked powercreep. At this point we can't even point our collective fingers at one thing, because there are so many things that are problems that any one thing can't just be nerfed to "solve it". We are in a phase right now where supports snowball adcs too quickly, adcs reach their power spikes too soon, and as a result bot lanes decide games more than is fair. We had a phase where junglers and mid laners camped the shit out of bot and bot lane had no agency over the game results and we saw the ADC in 2k17 meme arise, but instead of addressing the problem of how fast bot lane could power spike off of early advantages riot accelerated the tempo of bot lane power spikes in several ways until we found ourselves at the point we are in now. This is part of the problem with riot's modern philosophy of rotating of the meta instead of trying to create a balanced game.

Support is probably the most power crept class thought that ages. If you looks at S1-2 they were pretty much ward bots. S3-4-5 they were pretty much ether a budget tank or budget mage or an enchanter buying mage items. Ever since they got their own item line they have gotten a ton of power that just flat out did not exist before. Supports used to be mostly just general utility with stuff like thresh lantren and CC bots to what we have today where they can keep their ADC alive though pretty much anything.

Well, why should the support class suffer by being basically ward bots / useless? They levelled them up to the point where their input in the game can be of the same importance as any other role, and I really like that.

There is a difference between blatantly overpowered/broken af and "useless".
They never were useless otherwise they wouldn't have been played.

The only utility they really provided was the CC offered by their kit and their wards. Also, if a tank, being a meatshield. 

Now, they have itemization options to help buff the ADC damage, keep them alive longer, heal / shield the entire team, even do some damage in some cases, all while still being able to ward, but also not having a lot of damage, or a lot of tankiness.

Supports really were never useless.  They just didn't provide massive shields or do tons of damage.  They still provided tons of utility, and their damage and healing/shielding were still relevant, just not huge.

As a Support main who prefers to play healing Champions I find myself being outlaned by almost everything and I feel like my items are just helping me be more impactful than a minion at any stage of the game, not actually giving me any sense of power to support my team.

Bot Lane is immediately lost to the Mid player who didn't get their role and so just decided to take their mage Bot to "Support"; they buy a warding item and then just build their usual and end up being as much as a danger to my team as their Mid, meanwhile I'm still a cannon minion.
Then you're playing the role wrong and don't understand matchups or even your own champion.

Proactive playstyle requires more thought than reactive, which is mostly muscle memory what comes to Janna or Lulu. Nami's a fun one, she combines aspects from both, same with Zyra.

Playmaker support has to observe and choose;

- where
- how

Enchanter;

Maybe easy to pull off the combo, but hard engage supports are harder to play in general compared to enchanters.

The problem is these supports aren't PAYING for their shield and heal power. They're building friggin MR, armor, and HP while having 600 HP shields. They don't have to use them on themselves because they have resistances, meaning you can't abuse their weakness, making them choose to shield themselves, and killing the carry, or making them use the shield on the carry, and killing them. Assassins and the like got more damage because it's harder to kill. The runes came after the overpowered shields and heals. It's the reaction, not the cause. Problem is the ADCs get better at doing what they're supposed to do for free whether they attack a minion or a champion(kiting), while also getting 600 HP shields on support spells and 2000 HP shields on locket for the whole team.

Riot needs to take runes and masteries back to season 2-3. Back when you could choose a little bit of penetration, a little bit of damage, a little bit of attack speed, a little bit of lifesteal, a little bit of damage % on lower hp targets, or basically the same thing but in reverse for defenses. Then supports had support only items to sustain them in lane, give them vision, give mana regen, get back to lane faster, etc.

Right now it's just 'Cram as many numbers as I can into one box and then throw it at them'. It's boring. The counterplay is basically 'Have bigger numbers than them'. Why do you think that LCS players don't even fight any more in games? Because all it takes is one death to give the enemy team so many more stats than you have and then you physically cannot win. :/
